body:
This is a refactor of the `flutter-intellij` build tool to support multiple platforms including Mac and Windows. Several other bugs and changes were included to streamline and speed up the build process as well.  Additionally, a new  target, 'artifacts' has been added to aid in identifying needed downloads. 

Summary of changes
- 'unpack' cli arg is moved up used in Setup and Build commands to determine if artifacts should be unpacked again.
- Artifacts are now unpacked to version tagged directories. This cuts down on disk I/O on repeated or bulk builds and should speed up the process.
- Artifacts are unpacked using `dart:archive` package instead of relying on local `tar` and `zip` commands.
- `gradle.properties` updated to provide IDEA version to builds and also fix a bug with the `name` property used for determining the plugin name.
- Housekeeping: more comments, renamed variables, Green text for separators and red text for errors in log output.
- `plugin.bat` file created for invocation on Windows platforms.
- More specific changes/info can be found in commit message history.
- 
Addresses: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/6052

## Pre-launch Checklist

- [x] I read the [Contributor Guide] and followed the process outlined there for submitting PRs.
- [x] I read the [Tree Hygiene] wiki page, which explains my responsibilities.
- [x] I read the [Flutter Style Guide] _recently_, and have followed its advice.
- [x] I signed the [CLA].
- [x] I listed at least one issue that this PR fixes in the description above.
- [x] I updated/added relevant documentation (doc comments with `///`).
- [x] I added new tests to check the change I am making, or this PR is [test-exempt].
- [x] All existing and new tests are passing.

<!-- Links -->
[Contributor Guide]: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Tree-hygiene#overview
[Tree Hygiene]: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Tree-hygiene
[test-exempt]: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Tree-hygiene#tests
[Flutter Style Guide]: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Style-guide-for-Flutter-repo
[CLA]: https://cla.developers.google.com/
[flutter/tests]: https://github.com/flutter/tests
[breaking change policy]: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Tree-hygiene#handling-breaking-changes
[Discord]: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Chat

comment_data.body: Since the `artifacts` directory is now versioned, it might be good to include "-\<version\>" in the backquotes.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -42,7 +50,10 @@ Only build the specified IntelliJ version. `ID` is one of the "version" strings
 Normally the archive files are not unpacked if the corresponding directory exists. This flag forces the archive files to be unpacked.
 
 
-The make function must generate the correct `plugin.xml` for each platform and generate the correct artifacts for each. In release mode the archive files are always unpacked (--unpack is implied). The plugin files are saved in the `artifacts` directory. In release mode a subdirectory of `artifacts` is created which has the name of the release and they are put there. During a local dev/test run the subdirectory is not created and the created files are children of `artifacts`.
+The make function must generate the correct `plugin.xml` for each platform and generate the correct artifacts for each. In release mode 
+the archive files are always unpacked (--unpack is implied). The plugin files are saved in the `artifacts` directory.

comment_data.body: Awesome! Never occurred to me to automate that.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -58,23 +69,32 @@ Both unit and integration tests need to run, and tests should work whether runni
 *   `-i, --[no-]integration`
 Run GUI-based integration tests (or not).
 
-TBD: We may need some mechanism to automatically upload testing artifacts, since we can no longer attach zip files to email. This could also potentially be addressed by creating a 'dev' channel for the plugin on the JetBrains store, and publishing to it when we have release candidates.
+TBD: We may need some mechanism to automatically upload testing artifacts, since we can no longer attach zip files to email. 
+This could also potentially be addressed by creating a 'dev' channel for the plugin on the JetBrains store, and publishing to it
+when we have release candidates.
 
 
 ### Deploy
 
-Automatically upload all required artifacts to the JetBrains site. This function will print instructions to retrieve the password from valentine then prompt for the password to log into the JetBrains site. It has no options. Returns a success or failure code to play nice with shell commands.
-(Used primarily by the dev channel Kokoro job. Not sure if it works for uploading to the stable channel.)
+Automatically upload all required artifacts to the JetBrains site. This function will print instructions to retrieve the password from 
+valentine then prompt for the password to log into the JetBrains site. It has no options. Returns a success or failure code to play nice 
+with shell commands. (Used primarily by the dev channel Kokoro job. Not sure if it works for uploading to the stable channel.)
 
 ### Generate
 
-Generate a `plugin.xml` from `plugin.xml.template` to be used for launching a runtime workbench. This is different from the ones generated during building because it will have a version range that allows use in all targeted platforms.
+Generate a `plugin.xml` from `plugin.xml.template` to be used for launching a runtime workbench. This is different from the ones generated 
+during building because it will have a version range that allows use in all targeted platforms.
 
 
 ### Lint
 
 Run the lint tool. It checks for bad imports and prints a report of the Dart plugin API usage.
 
+### Artifacts
+
+Identifies artifacts that are needed, whether they exist, and provides urls that may have the required package

comment_data.body: The oldest version we build now is 2021.1, so you can simplify this.
Right on. I left it jic there were some internal requirements.

-The make function must generate the correct `plugin.xml` for each platform and generate the correct artifacts for each. In release mode the archive files are always unpacked (--unpack is implied). comment_data.body: Actually, it's not the `artifacts` dir that's versioned, rather, the extracted contents _in_ the directory. Previously, each subsequent build would have to delete and re-write the `android-studio`, `Dart`, and `idea` directories. Instead, we now unpack to version labeled sub-directories and only re-create if forced (-`u`, `rebuildCache`) or if the directory is older than the zip/tar package.  So I _think_ this can stay 'as is'.  I think there's some ambiguity around 'artifact' as a folder, 'artifact' as the downloaded source/dependencies, and the 'artifact' generated from the build process itself...we can unravel all of that later though.

commit.message:
Refactor of tool/plugin to support windows based platforms in addition to *nix based OS's.

`plugin.bat`
Add bat version of plugin tool for windows platforms.

`util.dart`
Refactor 'removeAll' and replace system calls with async library calls.
Add 'archive' package and create specific methods for extracting tar and zip files to replace old system calls.
Added agnostic gradle wrapper call method.

`artifact.dart`
Use path.join to safely create file/folder paths.
Include check for Windows version of IDEA artifact.
Repalce system calls to tar/zip with library calls.

`build_spec.dart`
Inlined 'createArtifacts' since it's only ever called from the named constructor and really shouldn't be accessible from anywhere else.
Inverted the product check logic and use 'firstWhereOrNull' with '.exists.', makes it cleaner and shoul also make reasoning about the order of artifact checks easier in the future.
Add references to windows versions of IDEA and Android Studio.
Fix 'toString' method to report actual version info. Kept release jic.

`plugin.dart`
Use agnostic calls to Gradle.

`runner.dart`
Use path.join to safely create file/folder paths.

`flutter-idea/build.gradle.kts`
Change resources root in gradle to use project.rootDir, side-stepping the need for a 'symlink' file in the build process.

`AUTHORS`
Add myself to Authors list.

Refactor of `tool/plugin` to support multiple platforms.

`artifact.dart`
  - Use `path.join` to safely create file/folder paths.
 - 'artifacts' as a directory location is sometimes referenced with and without a root path, this could lead to inconsistencies with identifying already downloaded files or unpacking existing files. Prefixing a 'rootPath' to Artifact and ArtifactManager references.

  Refactored `Artifact`:
   - 'bareArchive' no longer required, all artifacts are unpacked to matching structures.
   - Added `ideaVersion` to list of fields
   - All fields are final
   - `exists` is now async, `existsSync` for sync checks.
   - `filePath` getter uses platform safe paths and returns full path to artifact file.

  Refactored `ArtifactManager`:
   - Simplified `provision` behavior.
   - Use `archive` library to handle unpacking artifacts instead of cmd calls to `tar` and `zip`

`build_spec.dart`
 - Inlined 'createArtifacts' since it's only ever called from the named constructor and really shouldn't be accessible from anywhere else.
 - Provide better logic for determining artifact file names based on current/targeted platform/version, etc.
 - Fix 'toString' method to report actual version info. Kept release jic.

`edit.dart`
 - Ensure correct artifact folder names using ide + version

`plugin.dart`
 - Use agnostic calls to Gradle wrapper.
 - Add `platform` command line arg, defaults to detected platform except for Mac ARM, not yet supported by Dart:io
 - `unpack` command line arg moved up. All dependent build methods should now use it correctly. This changes some of the previous 'rebuildCache' behavior, but with the new artifact identifcation logic, it shouldn't cause problems.

`runner.dart`
 - Use path.join to safely create file/folder paths.
 - Change `name` to `ideaPluginName`. This fixes a hidden bug: The `name` property is set by Gradle based on the project folder and isn't overidden by the `gradle.properties` file. This causes errors if the project is cloned to a folder other than `flutter-intellij`.
 - `ideaVersion` added to `gradle.properties` to support identifying correct libraries for compilation.

`util.dart`
 - Refactor 'removeAll' and replace system calls with async library calls.
 - Add 'archive' package and create specific methods for extracting tar and zip files to replace old system calls.
 - `curl` now follows redirects.
 - Added `execLocalGradleCommand` for making platform dependent gradle wrapper calls
 - Add 'asError' param to 'log' method. Formats message with ansi.red.
 - Change separator to output green text, leave red for errors.

`flutter-idea/build.gradle.kts`
 - Change resources root in gradle to use project.rootDir, side-stepping the need for a 'symlink' file in the build process.

`AUTHORS`
 - Add myself to Authors list.

`plugin.bat`
 - Add bat version of plugin tool for windows platforms.

Other general housekeeping, code cleanup, reformatting, etc...
Add new 'artifact' target for plugin tool. This target just reports on which artifacts are needed, whether they exist, and suggestions for downloading if they are not found.
Update README.md to provide documentation for the new build target.

Update reporting message.
Fix erroneous reference to fileName.
Update default gradle.properties to use new 'ideaPluginName'

Minor bf&i in current branch:
  - `runner.runGradleCommand` now takes a bool instead of a String for the `testing` param.
  - Rename `buildPlugin` `version` param to `flutterPluginVersion`
  - Update `product-matrix.json` version targets for Idea 2022.2
  - Fix result/return logic on 'removeAll', empty/non-existent directories should count as 'removed'.
  - Allow `plugin.xml` and `studio-contribs.xml` to be generated asynchronously. Remove 2nd call to argResults['only-version'] to avoid errors.
  - Remove directory checks in `applyEdits` since we only apply edits to files.

- Remove check for android-studio versions < 2020
- Fix product-matrix.json for IDEA 2022.2.2.  '222.3244.4' was an EAP, not stable. Correct version should address build issues.

title: Support multi-platform builds
